intro: Lobelia camporum var. lundiana, commonly known as the mountain lobelia, is a perennial herb native to the high elevations of the Appalachian Mountains. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in rocky or wooded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
